title: Community-Police Engagement and Partnerships for Preventing Terror Crime: a collaboration involving researchers in the UK, in the US and in N I
abstractText:
Efforts to counter al Qaeda (AQ) linked or influenced, and other, forms of terrorism are increasingly drawing upon community-based initiatives.This study seeks to establish research collaboration between leading academics in the UK, US and Northern Ireland, who have been undertaking research examining community-police engagement and partnership in helping to prevent terror crime. Questions that will be focussed on include:

  • How is success to be captured and measured? 
  • What are the training implications at both community and policing levels?
  • What tensions might there be between police and communities?
